page.title: 03FARMING IN GOXHILL CONT.
page.content: Goxhill has a number of small areas of traditional permanent grass meadow. These are used by small dairy farmers or as grazing for ponies of which there are many - they outnumber dogs as pets within the village. Soft fruit is grown in and around Goxhill. Raspberries, blackcurrants, strawberries and gooseberries are all grown and harvested in the "Pick Your Own" style when in season. The area was particularly famous for its tomatoes and salad vegetables in the recent past. High labour and heating costs drove the owners out of this form of agriculture and the greenhouses are now used for the cultivation of flowers, as in the case of Hawthorne Gardens. Much of the soft fruit farming and horticulture is carried out by families of Dutch origin.
